S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

           S. 1800                                                  A. 1941

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   January 12, 2011

       IN SENATE -- Introduced by Sen. LAVALLE -- read twice and ordered print-
         ed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Environmental
         Conservation

       IN  ASSEMBLY  -- Introduced by M. of A. THIELE -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         establishing  a  registry  program for saltwater recreational anglers;
         and to repeal section 13-0355 of the  environmental  conservation  law
         relating thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 13-0355 of the environmental  conservation  law  is
    2  REPEALED and a new section 13-0355 is added to read as follows:
    3  S 13-0355. REGISTRY PROGRAM FOR SALTWATER RECREATIONAL ANGLERS.
    4    1. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ESTABLISH, IMPLEMENT AND MAINTAIN A REGISTRY
    5  PROGRAM FOR SALTWATER RECREATIONAL ANGLERS WHICH SHALL PROVIDE FOR:
    6    A.  THE REGISTRATION, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, IDENTIFICATION AND
    7  CONTACT INFORMATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO ENGAGE IN RECREATIONAL FISHING IN
    8  THE NEW YORK STATE MARINE AND COASTAL DISTRICT; AND
    9    B. THE REGISTRATION, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE OWNER, OPERATOR
   10  AND IDENTIFICATION OF THE VESSEL IF SUCH VESSEL IS USED IN FISHING.
   11    2. A. THE REGISTRY PROGRAM ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION  SHALL
   12  COMPLY  WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE REGISTRY PROGRAM ESTABLISHED PURSUANT
   13  TO THE "MAGNUSON-STEVENS FISHERY CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT  REAUTHORI-
   14  ZATION ACT OF 2006" (16 U.S.C. S 1801 ET SEQ.).
   15    B.  UPON  ESTABLISHMENT  OF  THE  REGISTRY  PROGRAM  PURSUANT  TO THIS
   16  SECTION, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL APPLY TO THE NATIONAL  MARINE  FISHERIES
   17  SERVICE  OF  THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION FOR THE
   18  EXEMPTED STATE DESIGNATION FROM FEDERAL REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS.
   19    3. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL NOT CHARGE A FEE FOR THE REGISTRATION REQUIRED
   20  PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   21    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03851-01-1
memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1800

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to establishing
a registry program for saltwater recreational anglers; and to repeal
section 13-0355 of the environmental conservation law relating thereto

PURPOSE:
To establish a no-fee registry program for saltwater recreational
anglers in New York State.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 13-0355 of the Environmental Conservation Law relating to
marine fishing license regulations and fees is repealed and a new
Section 13-0355 is added which shall direct the commissioner of the
New York State Department of Environmental Conservation to establish,
implement and maintain a registry program for saltwater recreational
anglers.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, first
enacted in 1976, is the primary law governing marine fisheries in
United States federal waters. pursuant to the Magnuson-Stevens
Fishery Conservation and Management Reauthorization Act of 2006,
several provisions were revised and the National Saltwater Angler
Registry was created. The purpose of this registry is to identify all
saltwater anglers that can be contacted to obtain more accurate
recreational fishery information to improve fisheries management.
Beginning in 2011, there will be a fee collected by the National
Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to cover administrative costs
associated with his federal registry program.

The National Saltwater Angler Registry will exempt anglers from this
federal registry if their state has its own registration or licensing
system. This legislation is necessary to afford New York State
saltwater recreational anglers such exemption. It directs the
commissioner of the Department of Environmental Conservation to
establish, implement and maintain a registry program for saltwater
recreational anglers in New York State which will comply with the
Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Reauthorization
Act of 2006. Upon the establishment of this, New York State
Conservation shall apply to the National Marine Fisheries Service of
the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for the exempted
state designation from federal regulation requirements. There will be
no departmental fees charged for this registry program for saltwater
recreational anglers in New York State.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2010:  S.7244

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
